title: CSCL Scenario Management Course Utilizing Script-Based Monitoring

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in PBL-based collaborative learning and practical language education
context.additional_context: Analyzing complex interaction data in BYOD environments to support instructors' real-time decision-making during language projects

learning_goals: Using monitoring indicators linked to the learning design blueprint, learners can diagnose CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) progress with 80% accuracy.
Learners can classify learner interaction patterns into three types—active participation, passive participation, and unproductive activity—using script-based analysis tools.
Based on analytical data, learners can identify timely instructional intervention points and develop effective feedback strategies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
